item.description:
HOME by Yann Arthus-Bertrand

(produced by Elzevir Film and Europacorp, 2009, 93 min, digiBeta)

World Premiere

FREE

Tickets available first-come, first-served at the admissions desk starting at 6 pm.

HOME by Yann Arthus-Bertrand

(produced by Elzevir Film and Europacorp, 2009, 93 min, digiBeta)
World Premiere

Ticketholders are invited to a reception in the ICA's theater from 6 - 7 pm.

See our world in a whole new lightâ€”captured from above. Presented as part of World Environmental Day, HOME will premiere simultaneously throughout the world on June 5. Be a part of this global event.

Yann Arthus-Bertrand, an internationally recognized photographer and writer, takes us on a fascinating and original journey all around the planet. Narrated by Glenn Close, the film is a travel notebook, comprised of mesmerizing shots of landscapes, water currents, and roads, bringing to light its magnificent beauty. HOME invites us to stop for a moment in order to look at our planet and realize how we treat its treasures and beauty.

The screening of HOME and the reception are made possible by the support of PUMA. Special thanks to the Cultural Services of the French Consulate in Boston.
item.how_to_find_us: John will be at the reception feeling right at HOME
item.name: HOME by Yann Arthus-Bertrand
